name: Sybaris Northbrook

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, so I was really worried this was going to be a trashy, sleazy type place with upscale prices. I was more than happily surprised! My husband and I chose to do the afternoon away (again, another "by the hour" move that I thought would be a little weird) since we would have to make arrangements for pets, etc to do the overnight. The afternoon was actually perfect for us. I drove up and my Audi was right at home with the Mercedes & Lexus vehicles checking in. Check-in was quick and easy. We got to our unit and my husband and I were really blown away. Thick plush carpeting, along with really nice bathrobes greeted us. We had a Majestic suite and the pool was amazing - perfect size. I don't think we'd do any unit other than a Majestic or Chalet now that we have been spoiled. There is an adult TV station along with a swing in the closet for the adventurous. We were there to just reconnect and spend some quality time together. I brought us some champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, and other snacks and we spent a great afternoon swimming in the pool, hot tub, and enjoying the steam room. Everything was VERY CLEAN. I was really worried about that as well. The only complaint I heard was that the towels weren't great and so I brought us some of our own. That was a good move as they don't give you enough towels. Whether you are looking for some fantasy playtime or just simply a place to relax without interruption, this was great. My husband wants to come back once a month just to decompress! We'll probably try another one of the resorts in the future just to see the difference.
reviews.title: Not cheesy - Very fun & romantic!
Loved It
reviews.text: Just remember, bring anything that you might want because there are no phones and you will not be leaving once you arrive. The room has a microwave, refrigerator, and ice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed using an on-line coupon and got $100 off the Paradise Pool Suite. I then paid an extra fee for early check in as we were coming from a long way out of town. Felt a little silly when checking in but then realized we weren't fooling anyone:) Room was amazingly clean and we enjoyed the use of the pool and hottub without any kids or swimsuits. We will be back but next time come down without evening plans so we can just relax and never leave our room. Great stay (we are picky) and would recommend.
reviews.title: So relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed for one night. We were able to use an online coupon to upgrade our room but had to stay on a thursday night. The room was very clean and had everything you wish for. I would however recomend to ask for extra towels ahead of time. We ran out of the wine we brought and the front desk was able to accomidate us very quickly as well. The water was warm in the pool and the hot tub. The massage chair was out of this world. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Very fun place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very quick check-in. The check-in building has some romantic accessories for sale. Everyone receives a gate code so there is no worry of others wandering around the property. Each "room" actually looks like a cottage. They look like they have windows from the outside but there are none. We reserved a Deluxe Whirlpool room. Inside was a very large whirlpool tub (empty and clean) with mirrors on 2 sides, the bed across from it with mirrors above, angled above and at the headboard, also mirrors on the wall, a nice massaging chair, steam room and the bathroom was set separately behind a wall. The toilet is in a separate room. There is a standup shower and overhead heat lamps by the vanity sink. Bathroom amenities were shampoo, conditioner, soap, mouthwash and 2 specially packaged pre-pasted toothbrushes. The main room also had a small table with 2 chairs and a small refrigerator. Fun colored lights around the bed. Be sure to try the accessory in the closet. We paid extra for late check-out so we had plenty of time for relaxation. Sign up on their website to receive special deals otherwise you'll pay regular price. We'd like to go again for sure. Maybe the same room type or maybe a pool next time.
reviews.title: Amazing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited the Sybaris in Northbrook for our anniversary, and I must be honest we had our doubts about cleanliness. We need not have worried, from the moment you check in the staff and the property are fantastic. We were given our chalet number and directions then we were off to our room. On opening the door its a big WOW. We chose the Paradise Suite because of the pool and there it was crystal clear water and the rest of the room sparkled. It was time to have some our time! So we closed the door and left the world behind, put some CD's in the CD changer and hit the pool and Hot Tub. We both said at the end of our visit we would be back and we will.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes its expensive BUT you get what you pay for and this is worth every penny. If you are looking for a romantic get away where you can leave the world behind but don't have the time for a flight to tropical climates. This is the place for you. Book it you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great local romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very skeptical when booking this hotel as an early Valentine's Day gift for my husband, but we've been married 10 years and he has wanted to go for a long time, so I took the plunge...literally! I booked a pool suite and it was great! Very clean, cleaner than I expected and very relaxing. We were amazed that we were in our own little "hut" and it was so secluded! The massage chair was a nice perk. The only complaints were the steam shower. The spikets from the ceiling hurt they were so strong and as we were collecting our belongings to leave we noticed a small amount of ants were collecting by the far edge of the poolside.
reviews.title: The Sybaris has changed

likes.liked: — Due to the time of year with weather - simply location
likes.disliked: — The bed was horrible - the check-in unusually aggravating

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Chalet
reviews.text: My husband and I have been members of the Sybaris now for almost twenty years and like so much we have seen in that time many changes. We typically stay in the Paradise Swimming Pool Suite however have stayed in other suites occassionally. It is a nice place for the four or five hours of get away deal in the middle of the day however when staying overnight we found the bed to be extremely uncomfortable. Actually I don't think I slept but two hours the bed was so bothersome to my back. As for cleanliness - it was and has continued to be clean and kept up. Interestingly (and we believe probably due to this day and age insurance wise) the pools in the newer rooms are very shallow -only about 3 foot deep - we recall in the older suites them to be much deeper. Anyway putting that aside as it is only one night and a private pool - as we have a pool and hot tub at home we noted the chemical in the hot tub to be very off as it was sudsing up. Lastly the check-in was a hassle this time so much so my husband almost told the kid to cancel our reservations right then and there. Reasoning was I booked it for us (for our 24th anniversary for the night) and placed the charges on our businesd card and forgot about that. When he went to check-in they ask for your credit card and he handed his AMX to them and they said no that's not the right card. He came out to the car and said what card did I place it on and I totally forgot it was on our business card and I said honestly I don't know. He went back in (by then several younger couples had checked in and were on their way to their rooms and here we were still sitting there due to this) and upon going back in told the guy he didn't have a clue what card it was placed on but here was his AMX take care of it with that furthering it with we'd never gone through this type of fiasco and had been staying there now over twenty years. He was ready to tell them cancel it and the kid took his other credit card. We were both ticked - and interestingly got our charges on our Amx and it was put through on the initial card called in - our biz card as opposed to the personal gold card he'd handed to him. Anyway - we have decided at this time not to renew our membership and in light of all are now believing comfortable beds and so forth to be more in order. All said, it is a nice little get away and we've gone there again for over 20 years.

reviews.title: We loved it!

likes.liked: — Pool & Hot Tub in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been to the Sybaris in Northbrook and Mequon. Both are similar and equally nice. There are (5) locations total, and you can check out the suite differences via in-room pictures on the official (and easy to navigate) website www.sybaris.com. In the Majestic Pool suite that we love, there is a hot tub attached to the pool and a separate "whirlpool" in the bedroom. The bedroom is separate from the pool room of course. The pool room containes a 22-ft pool, attached hot tub with jets and temp control, steam room for two, table and chairs for poolside drinks. The bedroom has a large over-sized king bed, small table, booth with table, TV, DVD, Stereo (which can be played in bedroom, pool room, or both), small fridge and microwave, kitchen-style sink and a "neat" lighting system. The interior decor is slightly (and I'm being nice here) tacky, but no one seems to mind because the suites themselves are so nice.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway
Loved the Sybaris Experience.
reviews.text: When I first mentioned the idea of going to the Sybaris to my wife she said, "You mean that tacky pool motel we see on TV? It can't be clean, and how private could it be?" Well, thankfully I did some research and found that the pools are consistantly sanitized and thoroughly cleaned after each guest, rooms are cleaned emensely, and come to find out that the suites themselves are each their own separate building. After much begging and pleading, my wife finally agreed to "give it a try," and she doesn't regret it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Starting with the moment you call the Sybaris to make a reservation, you are treated as if you are a guest of a 5-star hotel. Their customer service is fantastic. They will help you out every step of the way, and are trained well to answer any "spur of the moment" questions that you may have.
reviews.title: Unforgetable! Unique!

reviews.text: FYI- You DO NEED TO BE A MEMBER to be able to be a guest and make a reservation. The memberships are annual, and start at $30/year. Some memberships will actually give you additional "free" time at the beginning or end of your stay. Check the website for further membership information.
reviews.title: 1st Time Visitor - LOVED IT!!!!
Excellent Getaway!
reviews.text: So once you have made your reservation, it's time to start your vacation...and I call it a vacation because no matter how long you plan to stay; one afternoon, overnight, or numerous days; the feeling you get while in your suite is one that you are hundreds of miles away from everyday life. You drive up to the main building with the reservation desk and employees. Approach the employee at the desk and after a quick process of payment, you are on your way. You will get a key and directions to your suite. You will drive past the initial gate- thats right, this is a gated community of suites for complete privacy- and drive to your suite. You will pull into your own driveway and unload your luggage into your private suite. The suites are separate buildings and DO NOT share walls with any other rooms. There also are no windows, to ensure 100% privacy. No phones to bother you, so bring a cell if you need a phone.

description: Sybaris Pool Suites located in Northbrook, Illinois is a Romantic Paradise like no other. The suites feature your own private swimming pool with a tropical waterfall, soothing whirlpool tub, misting steamroom, cozy fireplace, relaxing massage chairs and so much more to make your stay unforgettable.
